meanings.definition: Harsh or grim in appearance or outline.
meanings.sent1: The starker landscape of winter made everything seem desolate.
meanings.sent2: The artist used starker colors to create a more dramatic effect in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The starker reality of his failed plan hit him like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent4: The contrast between the lush garden and the starker desert was striking.
meanings.sent5: The starker truth was revealed when the lies unraveled.

meanings.sent1: The starker tree branches stood out against the gray sky.
meanings.sent2: She felt vulnerable in the starker light of the room.
meanings.sent3: The starker truth was that he had forgotten his clothes for the play.
meanings.sent4: The starker reality of the situation left no room for pretense.
meanings.sent5: The starker facts were laid bare for all to see.
